ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to use OLEX, CrysAlis, ConQuest and Mercury to at least some extent, as well as lots of insight into how chemical crystal structures are modeled and refined
I learned how to solve crystal structures which is definitely an incredibly useful skill to have. I also learned how to decipher .cif files and be able to understand published crystal structure data.

I walked in knowing little to nothing about crystallography. I walked out knowing how to model disorder and solve crystal structures. In addition, I believe I understand most of the theory behind the crystallography.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: really great course but could benefit by having less theory at the beginning and more time to use the programs and get the practical skills required to solve structures- maybe a 70/30 practical/theory split instead of 50/50

Overall, this course was amazing. At times however, I feel like we rushed through some of the hard parts of the theory. I eventually learned those parts but I was frustrated at the time. I do think that Brandon did an amazing job and did the best he could. Overall, I really enjoyed the course!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, it was interesting and relevant to my graduate work
Yes! It's a very interesting subject and good for providing more of an understanding of why crystallography is so important.
I would definitely recommend this to another student. I really enjoyed this course and it honestly feels like I got a lot out of it. At times it is challenging but, it is well worth it.
